Description: Fragment of a carnelian ear- or hair-ring with angular edges, well-smoothed and finished. Triangular in section. On both outer sides a circumferential line in the lower part. On the edge of the object, between these two lines, many small parallel ridges, perpendicular to the circumferential lines.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.16B, upper layer
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 148)
